description: Create, edit and manage customer support tickets.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Unique Identifier. You can find it at Admin->Channels->API->OAuth Clients

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Secret value you received when you registered your application with Zendesk

args.name: code
args.info: Code you received from Zendesk after the user granted access

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: The same redirect URL as in received Code step.

blocks.name: getIncrementalTickets
blocks.description: Returns the tickets that changed since the start time. The results include tickets that were updated by the system. The endpoint can return records where the updated_at time is earlier than the start_date time. The reason is that the updated_at value is updated only if the ticket update generates a ticket event. Otherwise, the timestamp of the previous update carries over.

blocks.name: getIncrementalTicketsEvents
blocks.description: Returns a stream of changes that occurred on tickets. Each event is tied to an update on a ticket and contains all the fields that were updated in that change. You can include comments in the event stream by using the comment_events sideload. See Sideloading below. If you don't specify the sideload, any comment present in the ticket update is described only by Boolean comment_present and comment_public object properties in the event's child_events array. The comment itself is not included.

blocks.name: getJobStatuses
blocks.description: This shows the current statuses for background jobs running.

blocks.name: getTickets
blocks.description: Tickets are ordered chronologically by created date, from oldest to newest. The first ticket listed may not be the absolute oldest ticket in your account due to ticket archiving. To get a list of all tickets in your account, use the Incremental Ticket Export endpoint.

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are assignee, assignee.name, created_at, group, id, locale, requester, requester.name, status, subject, updated_at

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

blocks.name: getSingleTicket
blocks.description: Returns a number of ticket properties, but not the ticket comments. To get the comments, use List Comments.

blocks.name: getTicketsByIds
blocks.description: Accepts a list of ticket ids to return. This endpoint will return up to 100 tickets records.

args.name: comment
args.info: A comment object that describes the problem, incident, question, or task. todo JSON

args.name: requesterId
args.info: The numeric ID of the user asking for support through the ticket

args.name: submitterId
args.info: The numeric ID of the user submitting the ticket

args.name: assigneeId
args.info: The numeric ID of the agent to assign the ticket to

args.name: groupId
args.info: The numeric ID of the group to assign the ticket to

args.name: collaboratorIds
args.info: An array of the numeric IDs of agents or end-users to CC on the ticket. An email notification is sent to them when the ticket is created

args.name: collaborators
args.info: An array of numeric IDs, emails, or objects containing name and email properties. An email notification is sent to them when the ticket is created. Example: collaborators: [ 562, someone@example.com, { name: Someone Else, email: else@example.com } ]

args.name: type
args.info: Allowed values are problem, incident, question, or task

args.name: priority
args.info: Allowed values are urgent, high, normal, or low

args.name: status
args.info: Allowed values are new, open, pending, hold, solved or closed. Is set to new if status is not specified

args.name: tags
args.info: Comma-separated of tags to add to the ticket

args.name: externalId
args.info: An ID to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

args.name: forumTopicId
args.info: The numeric ID of the topic the ticket originated from, if any

args.name: problemId
args.info: For tickets of type 'incident', the numeric ID of the problem the incident is linked to, if any

args.name: dueAt
args.info: For tickets of type 'task', the due date of the task. Accepts the ISO 8601 date format (yyyy-mm-dd)

args.name: ticketFormId
args.info: (Enterprise only) The id of the ticket form to render for the ticket

args.name: customFields
args.info: An array of the custom fields of the ticket. See below for details

args.name: viaFollowupSourceId
args.info: The id of a closed ticket for a follow-up ticket.

blocks.name: createTickets
blocks.description: Create many tickets from JSON file

args.name: tickets
args.info: JSON file contents array of tickets data. Example [{ticketData1}, {ticketData2}]. TicketData the same as when creating one ticket.

blocks.name: markSingleTicketAsSpam
blocks.description: Mark Ticket as Spam and Suspend Requester

blocks.name: markTicketsAsSpam
blocks.description: Mark Tickets as Spam and Suspend Requester

blocks.name: mergeTickets
blocks.description: Merges one or more tickets into the {id} target ticket.

args.name: targetComment
args.info: Private comment to add to the target ticket

args.name: sourceComment
args.info: Private comment to add to the source ticket

blocks.name: autocompleteTicketsProblems
blocks.description: Returns tickets whose type is 'Problem' and whose subject contains the string specified in the text parameter.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

blocks.name: removeCommentAttachment
blocks.description: Redaction allows you to permanently remove attachments from an existing comment on a ticket. Once removed from a comment, the attachment is replaced with a placeholder 'redacted.txt' file. Note that redaction is permanent. It is not possible to undo redaction or see what was removed. Once a ticket is closed, redacting its attachments is no longer possible.

blocks.name: uploadFiles
blocks.description: Adding multiple attachments to the same upload is handled by splitting requests and passing the API token received from the first request to each subsequent request. The token is valid for 3 days. Note: Even if private attachments are enabled in the Zendesk Support instance, uploaded files are visible to any authenticated user at the content_URL specified in the JSON response until the upload token is consumed. Once an attachment is associated with a ticket or post, visibility is restricted to users with access to the ticket or post with the attachment.

args.name: uploadToken
args.info: Upload token. Use it when need to upload more then 1 file and associate with token

args.name: uploadToken
args.info: Upload token. Use it when need to upload more then 1 file and associate with token

blocks.name: getSatisfactionRatings
blocks.description: List all received satisfaction rating requests ever issued for your account.

blocks.name: createSatisfactionRating
blocks.description: Create a rating for solved tickets, or for tickets that were previously solved and then reopened.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

blocks.name: getTicketAudits
blocks.description: Lists the audits for a specified ticket.

blocks.name: getTicketSingleAudits
blocks.description: Get audit for a specified ticket by audit ID

blocks.name: removeWordFromTicketComment
blocks.description: Permanently removes words or strings from a ticket comment. Specify the string to redact in an object with a text property. Example: {"text": "credit-card-number"}. The characters of the word or string are replaced by the ▇ symbol. Redaction is permanent. You can't undo the redaction or see what was removed. Once a ticket is closed, you can no longer redact strings from its comments.

blocks.name: skipTicket
blocks.description: Record a new skip for the current user

blocks.name: getSingleMetric
blocks.description: Get ticket metric by metric ID

blocks.name: getSingleTicketMetric
blocks.description: Get ticket metric by ticket ID

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

blocks.name: getRequestListByStatus
blocks.description: Get list of requests by status

blocks.name: deleteMembership
blocks.description: Immediately removes a user from a group and schedules a job to unassign all working tickets that are assigned to the given user and group combination.

blocks.name: deleteMemberships
blocks.description: Immediately removes users from groups and schedules a job to unassign all working tickets that are assigned to the given user and group combinations.

args.name: groupMembershipIds
args.info: Comma-separated list of group membership ids
